alert.note: Alert for City of Suffolk; Isle of Wight (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:53AM EST until December 18 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Isle of Wight County in southeastern Virginia... The City of Suffolk in southeastern Virginia... * Until 400 AM EST. * At 1253 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Smithfield, Windsor, Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Chesapeake, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Kings Fork, Driver, Crittenden, Whaleyville, Rescue, Indika, Kilby, Chuckatuck, Longview, Wills Corner, Wilroy, Magnolia and Suffolk Airport. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: City of Suffolk; Isle of Wight
